company: Ipswich Town, Colchester United, Major league Soccer and many more
description: At just 15 years of age, I managed my first football team in the Colchester and District U18 league. From there, I got employed part-time by Ipswich Town's community project breifly, before taking a full-time role at Colchester United. I worked for various clubs in their academies throughout this decade and hold a range of coaching qualifications.

company: University of Suffolk and University of Birmingham, respectively
description: I went back to school in 2008 to complete an undergraduate in Psychology and Childhood Development. On completion, I was offered a PhD in Sport and Performance Psychology. I graduated from the University of Birmingham in 2015.

role: Teaching Fellow, Lecturer, and Senior Lecturer
company: Aberystwyth University, Anglia Ruskin University, Buckinghamshire New University, University of Chichester and the University of Essex.
description: Whilst completing my doctorate, I undertook various Associate and casual lecturing roles before being appointed as a Senior Lecturer at the University of Chichester. After two years there, I was offered a role back in Colchester (the town where I was born) at the University of Essex, where I stayed for just over six years.

company: Play Aid, Ulster University, and Erasmus University Rotterdam
description: I am now in the fourth phase of my career and work to support the above organisations with strategic leadership, training, and research to support organisational and culture change.
